0.title: Sweet Potato Nachos with Vegetarian Chilli
ingredients: 300g sweet potatoes, thinly sliced into 0.5cm disks
1/2 - 1 tsp chilli flakes, depending on taste
method: Preheat oven to 200°C and line a baking tray with baking paper.
Arrange sweet potato on tray, brush with 1/2 tsp oil and season with salt & pepper. Roast for 10 minutes, toss chips over, brush with another 1/2 tsp oil and roast for another 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, heat remaining oil, onion, garlic, cumin and half the chilli in a large frypan over medium heat and cook for a couple of minutes. Add tofu and cook for another minute.
Stir through tomatoes, beans, chickpeas and 1 tbs chopped coriander stems and simmer over low heat for 20 minutes, to thicken. Adjust seasoning.
Meanwhile, combine remaining chilli flakes, yoghurt and lemon juice in a bowl. Season.
Arrange nachos on an ovenproof plate, top with chilli, scatter over cheese and return to the oven for a few minutes to melt cheese.
To serve, drizzle over dressing and top with avocado and picked coriander leaves.

1.title: Greek Style Quesadilla
ingredients: 1 medium tomato, diced & drained on paper towel
method: Preheat sandwich press or large non-stick fry pan over medium heat.

Place two tortillas on a board and scatter over half the mozzarella, top with spinach, tomato, olives, feta and oregano. Top with remaining mozzarella and tortillas. Transfer to sandwich press or frypan, and toast until golden on both sides.
Cut the quesadillas in quarters and serve with tzatziki.

2.title: Flourless orange cake
method: Preheat oven to 170°C. Brush a round 22cm (base measurement) springform pan with melted butter to lightly grease. Line base with non-stick baking paper.

Place the oranges in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over medium heat. Cook for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Return to pan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil and cook for 15 minutes (this will reduce the bitterness of the peel). Refresh under cold water. Drain. Coarsely chop oranges. Remove and discard any seeds.
Place the orange in the bowl of a food processor and process until smooth.
Use an electric beater to whisk the eggs and sugar in a bowl until thick and pale. Add the orange, almond meal and baking powder and gently fold until just combined. Pour into prepared pan.
Bake for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Set aside for 15 minutes to cool.

Meanwhile, to make the orange syrup, use a zester to remove the rind from the orange. (Alternatively, use a vegetable peeler to peel the rind from orange. Use a small sharp knife to remove white pith. Cut rind into thin strips.) Juice orange.

Place rind in a saucepan of boiling water and cook for 5 minutes or until soft. Drain. Return to pan with orange juice and sugar. Place over low heat and cook, stirring, for 2-3 minutes or until the sugar dissolves and the syrup thickens.
Turn cake onto a serving plate. Use a skewer to gently prick the top. Spoon over syrup. Cut into wedges to serve.

3.title: Spicy Spanish Meatballs
method: Combine the pork, beef, breadcrumbs, egg, paprika, parsley, garlic and salt and pepper in a bowl. Mix to combine the ingredients. Place in the fridge and marinate up to overnight.
When you're ready to cook the meatballs, roll the meat mixture into 1 inch balls.
Head a dutch oven or other heavy pan with 1 tbsp olive oil over medium high heat. Brown the meatballs on all sides and place on a plate.
Deglaze the pan with the red wine and let it simmer for 2 minutes before adding in the tomatoes and smoked paprika. Simmer for 5 minutes then add the meatballs back in.
Cook the meatballs for 20 minutes, covered.
Serve with crusty bread and a glass of red wine.
